headline: Christmas Breakfast Sausage Casserole
description: This cheesy breakfast sausage casserole is easy to prep, chill overnight, and bake on Christmas morning for a comforting dish everyone will enjoy!

video.description: Make this special casserole for a Christmas morning treat.
video.name: Christmas Breakfast Sausage Casserole

name: Christmas Breakfast Sausage Casserole
recipeIngredient: 6 slices white bread, toasted and cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Crumble sausage into a medium skillet. Cook over medium heat until evenly brown; drain.
In a medium bowl, mix together mustard powder, salt, eggs and milk. Add the sausage, bread cubes, and cheese, and stir to coat evenly.
Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Cover, and chill in the refrigerator for 8 hours, or overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cover, and bake 45 to 60 minutes.
Uncover, and reduce temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until set

review.reviewBody: Really greasy, but easy to make and good to eat! Pretty decent start to the day.

Everyone loved this recipe, even our daughter who doesn‚Äôt care for egg dishes. I used the pork sausage from Aldi and made the recipe as is. The few pieces that were left heated up beautifully in the microwave. Why wait until Christmas to make it again? üòÅ. It would be perfect for potlucks or for overnight company or just for you.
Easy to make. I used hot Italian sausage and threw in some onion/garlic/cumin powder instead of the mustard. That spiced it up a bit, which I like.

This recipe has become a staple of our Christmas experience as we've made this for the past several years. This year we added diced onion and next year we will probably also add diced bell pepper and sliced mushroom. The only trouble we've had is that we cooked it the full 90 minutes this year without checking on it and it came out a bit overcooked, so next year we'll check it for doneness at 60 and 75 minutes. Definitely recommended for an easy to make and deliciously gratifying meal on Christmas morning or anytime!

My grandma would make this casserole for Christmas when I was a kid so it‚Äôs been tradition in my family for 20+ years. I‚Äôve never been able to make it quite like hers but this is the closest I can get! I definitely recommend adding 2 extra eggs since the bread soaks up most of the liquid. The mustard powder is an essential part for the flavor so definitely avoid omitting it if possible. It changes the game imo.

I generally never care for breakfast casseroles but this one was excellent. I was out of dry mustard, so I subbed in garlic powder, I used turkey breakfast sausage, and I used a bag of garlic croutons. I'll be making this again!
I double the recipe‚Ä¶ My family request this casserole every Christmas Holiday for the last 10 years.. it‚Äôs a must try..
We make this quite often sometimes we put hash brown patties on bottom of casserole dish first also try crumbled bacon instead of sausage all are great.

I make this every year for Christmas morning breakfast, as written, for my family and all the guests we have. I have made it for at least 12 years now. It‚Äôs one of our traditions. Everyone always loves it and it gets eaten quickly.
My most requested dish by the family! I use Italian sausage and sourdough bread, equal parts half and half and milk plus I add two more eggs. Absolutely the best breakfast bake!

I have made this recipe for my family every Christmas since finding it several years ago. The one change we made to it was to use maple breakfast sausage links. One of our favorites that we all look forward too!
I‚Äôve made this recipe for about 40 years now, essentially identical to this one. I usually use a few more eggs and more milk. I‚Äôve also used cooked, diced ham in lieu of sausage!

I also make this as written therefore the 5 stars. To rate 5 stars on a completely changed recipe doesn‚Äôt make sense to me. I have made some changes. One is I‚Äôve used is the maple flavored sausage. The original recipe is always a hit at home and church brunches

I make a similar version and have been making it for years.Spray pan with Pam. I line the pan with tater tots . I add cup of sharp cheddar cheese over tots, add sausage , another cup of cheese, then the egg mixture as mentioned ( I use a dozen eggs). Then a cup of cheddar. I usually use 3 cups of cheese. I have added 1/4 cup of onions , or green chiles (4 oz) or chopped jalapenos. Change it up. I do not cover. Take it out in about an hour and let it set for at least 5 minutes. Grill some corn or flour tortillas. Serve in the tortilla . No plate no silverware. Feed my cowboys at the ranch. They love it.
Great breakfast for guests!
I make this every year! It's a big hit at our home every Christmas
This is always a hit for special event sleepovers. I increase the eggs and cut back on the bread. Protein packed for our active crew.
I didn't have dry mustard, so substituted a squirt of regular mustard. I thought sausage might be too greasy, so used a thicker cut deli ham. Delish, leftovers went home with our friends!!!
made this as written but only subbed 1 lb of turkey breakfast sausage and wheat bread and added a can of green chilies. Boys loved it and ate it up!!!

This recipe has been in my family for forty years and it carries forward still. It‚Äôs a savory delicious breakfast casserole that makes any day feel like a holiday! Preparing the casserole at 10 pm the night before, you have the pure luxury of popping it into the preheated oven and forgetting about breakfast for an hour in the morning. I preheat my oven while I make coffee‚Ä¶ them pop the casserole in and disappear for an hour to enjoy the morning. Such a relief on Christmas (or any) morning and everyone absolutely loves it! A family heirloom‚Ä¶
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
Love this recipe year around. When my son comes home, he always requests it. I change the types of sausage I use to get a different taste but the original is always wonderful!

I made this for Christmas morning and made a few changes. I used Texas toast for the first layer, no need to toast, then I added the cooked sausage. Mixed the remaining ingredients, I used 5 eggs and a combination of half and half and milk, and poured over the bread and sausage and then topped with cheese. Delicious!!
This casserole is a holiday staple in my family. I usually make it just as the directions show. Sometimes I add canned mushrooms to half. Either way, it is delicious.

This recipe was highly rated and looked easy. So I tried it. It is easy. The first time I tried it, I put in too much bread apparently. (I used toasted French bread, diced.) It was just okay but I thought next time, less bread. So I made it again this morning...less bread. The recipe says calls to put it in a 9" x 13" glass dish...and when you make it exactly according to the recipe, using that size pan spreads it out it ends up being very thin. Still felt like too much bread. Okay...now the next time I make this I'm going to use the same amount of bread---6 slices toasted---only I'm going to double the custard part (eggs, milk, mustard and salt.) I doubt if I'll double the cheese. If it works better that way, I'll report back. If it doesn't work, I'm going to line the trash can with my copy of this recipe!
Such a hit with everyone!! Made it for Christmas morning and we did use Turkey sausage and had some salsa too, definitely putting this on repeat!
Maybe use a little salt because sausage and cheese can be salty
Very easy and quick to put together. I swapped out one of the cups of milk for heavy cream. Delicious!

The classic! I have made this exact same casserole for Christmas morning for well over 30 years. I found the recipe in a Betty Crocker Christmas recipes book that used to come out every holiday season. It‚Äôs a family tradition that is expected once a year, because that is only when I make it‚Äî-once a year. It‚Äôs easy and pretty simple. No frills but oh so delicious. Only variation‚Äî I always omit the salt as there is enough salt from the sausage for our family. There are rarely leftovers!

This recipe has established our new Christmas morning tradition! Takes a while, but it‚Äôs very easy and super delicious. I subbed the mustard powder for paprika (we‚Äôre an anti mustard household). Very highly recommend!!

Pretty good made last night and back this morning. The toast squares are a little mushy but all in all pretty good put my homemade hot sauce on it I think hash browns would be good with this give it a little more body
This is THE BEST breakfast casserole recipe just as it is written. Every one of my picky kids loves this!

Great make-ahead recipe for Christmas morning. Served with fresh fruit. I dressed up a little more to add additional flavor. Sauteed onion and red pepper with Italian sausage. Added some of my favorite seasoning blends and some sage. Used 6 eggs as recommended and a bag of seasoned croutons for bread. Used a cheese blend mixture. Sprinkled paprika on top. Family loved!
Awesome..make every Christmas..we have gluten free so we use hash browns instead of bread
Love this recipe. I typically use English muffins instead of loaf bread. I added bacon, onion and Jalape√±os to it as well. Also made some sausage gravy to go with it ????
Love it! I prefer to use croutons instead of bread. Always turns out great. I also like maple sausage or hot sausage.
I absolutely delicious
Followed the recipe exactly and it came out great! Perfect for a snow day when everyone was home .
We loved it!! I used Jimmy Dean Premium Pork Regular Sausage Roll. I added 8 eggs and saut√©ed a yellow onion. Other than that I followed the recipe!
Don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll ever have a Christmas without this
Made it for the first time Christmas morning 2020 and it was a hit!! I will definitely make again and not just at Christmas time.
Very good. I used 7 eggs, 2.5 cups milk, 2 cups cheese and 6 cups homemade bread, bread cubes. Good sausage is a must. Turned out perfect.

I've been making this recipe for years, with some changes. We use 8 eggs and 4 pieces of bread. And we add some onion powder. The quantities of everything else are unchanged. Make sure you don't over cook it after the foil comes off. 20-25 minutes is enough for us in the second stage.
It‚Äôs delicious!!!! Only thing I did forget to do was after I took off the tin foil was bring down the oven to 325. . . So it browned a lil but darker than I wanted it to but it was still delicious!

I changed it a bit to make it more like the recipe I was looking for. Instead of bread cubes are you six slices of white bread covered in butter and then layered my cook sausage bits shredded cheddar cheese on top of the sliced white bread I poured my egg mixture over it and let it soak in the fridge overnight and it turned out just delicious my family loves it and is already asking when am I going to make it again.
Made this casserole in Christmas Eve Day for Christmas morning. It was delicious! Will become a part of our family‚Äôs holiday traditions.

My family loved this Christmas morning. I prepped the day before. I made only minor changes. I used a good quality, dense, thick-sliced bread. Omitted salt. Added a sprinkle of pepper and poultry seasoning to the recipe. Used some of the cheese to top it with and also used a smaller pan (one that I use for brownies 7 x 11?). It puffs up beautiful and golden brown! So delicious.

This recipe has been a Christmas tradition in our family for about 15 years. I don't deviate too much since I have a couple picky eaters, but this recipe begs to have additions like veggies or other meats. I do double the eggs and add some additional half-n-half for creaminess, plus a little garlic powder. Lastly, I add a bit of cheese to the top during the last 20 minutes of cooking.
This turned out great! I used frozen hash browns instead of the bread and added BACON and fresh diced jalape√±os. The whole family loved it for Christmas breakfast!

This is an outstanding breakfast casserole. Made this for the first time for my family and everyone loved it so much they want me to make another. I upped the ingredients for twelve people and it turned out perfect.
Wonderful & easy (which makes it even more wonderful)!
I made it as recommended with the exception of using vegetarian Italian sausage and English muffins instead of bread. Absolutely delicious. My brother said it was my best Christmas casserole ever.

about to taste it. we live in Kuwait so no pork sausage. I found chicken sausage and sliced it instead of cooking it. I only saw Texas toast when I showed the video to my husband, so it's regular bread, mozzarella cheese and Tex Mex spices because I don't like mustard.

Merry Christmas!
I added 8 ounces diced ham and it was amazing - a huge hit with all the guests.

We used maple sausage and brioche bread and it turned out perfectly. This will be a Christmas morning tradition going forward in our family. Be sure to put it together the night before and chill in the fridge as it says to do in the recipe otherwise it will be soggy. Thanks for this gem of a recipe!
This was a real hit with my fambam!
I love this casserole anytime of the day!
My family loves munching on this while opening our presents on Christmas morning! My son says it's better than Christmas dinner.

I used cubed french bread I made in my bread machine instead of sliced bread. I made the cubes small and used the crust too. Also, added an egg and sauteed onions, mushrooms and peppers to the sausage. It was delicious!!

This is a really good breakfast casserole but I made it with 8 eggs instead of 4, I used heavy cream instead of milk, and I used crutons (texas toast) brand instead of toasted bread. I also added green onions. Everyone loved it!
Paul‚Äôs favorite breakfast casserole
Delicious! This is the best breakfast casserole I‚Äôve found so far and it‚Äôs going to be hard to beat!

Super tasty! I did everything as described with one exception. Since I was serving this as an entr√©e and not a breakfast, I switched the cheddar for montery jack to add a little zing. That worked well.

Made this the first time according to directions in a cast iron dutch oven on a campfire. Perfect! Was delicious. Then I made it again and added a 4 oz. can of diced green chilis. Served with salsa and sour cream, which makes it good as a supper or a breakfast.

I made this wonderful breakfast fast casserole and it was absolutely delicious! I used packaged precooked sausage crumbles which made this so easy. I also used half and half. My husband loved it! It was also great in the morning, having breakfast already put together to just pop into the oven.
I've made it in the past, take can of mushroom soup, mix with sherry and pour over top, then more cheese and bake for the last 30 minutes.
Tasted very good.
I make this all the time and everyone in my family loves it. I don‚Äôt use bread at all, but instead cover the bottom of the baking dish with frozen tater tots. This way I can just make it all
I used garlic bread. I was delicious!
I tweak this recipe

When looking for a breakfast recipe I specifically chose this one bc it basically has 5 main ingredients and these 5 items are general and always on hand in my kitchen. I made it exactly as the recipe said to and it turned out fine. I did use a small casserole dish but that‚Äôs not changing the recipe. I didn‚Äôt give this recipe 5stars only bc of it‚Äôs texture and that‚Äôs my own hang up. Thanks for sharing the recipe, I will definitely recommend
My Grandmother had originally given me this recipe and I lost it...I was heartbroken. Thank You for posting it here! I think of her every time I make it.

So delicious! Made it for a work brunch and it received rave reviews from everyone who ate it. Simple, minimal amount of work needed, inexpensive, and so tasty! Pretty much the best combination of qualities. Will be making again and again.

This is a favorite at our house. We have it at Christmas and on birthdays. I love that you can make it the night before and just slide it in the oven in the morning. I use a bag of croutons instead of bread, maple sausage, and 8-10 eggs. Perfect!
So Good! Everyone loved it!

I doubled the recipe with hot sausage and I added 2 cans of rotel drained, 1/2 cup more cheese 3 more eggs and 2 more toast. I was a bit runny that's why the extra eggs and toast. It was excellent. Taste great as leftovers too. Now my boys have breakfast for 3 days while I go back to work.
It is awesome and so easy!! I made it for Christmas and it was delicious, I have since made it, cut into portions and froze for weekday breakfasts.
Loved this recipe! I took it to a church breakfast and received a lot of compliments.
This stuff is awesome. I make it regularly now. Fabulous...

This was so easy and good! I fed 10 people who all loved it, from 18- months to 64 years old! I tore bread to cover the bottom of a greased 9x13 glass casserole dish. Put 4 pounds of cooked sausage ( half original, half sage), green onions and chopped mushrooms on top and then sprinkled about 3 cups mixed Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese on that. Beat 1 T dry mustard With a cup of milk and 18 eggs. Put in fridge overnight, followed instructions for baking and it came out perfectly. Yum!
Use way more eggs, and more cheese!
Everyone loved it. I will be sure to double the recipe for the next time.
I make this every year for Christmas and everyone raves about it. I double the recipe and use 1 pound spicy, 1 pound sage sausage. 5 stars!
I made this exactly as directed and it was wonderful.
Delicious!!!

I got this recipe in an email and had most ingredients on hand. I baked Texas toast cheesy garlic bread and let it dry out all day. I used an 11x7 pan, lined the bottom with the cheese bread, then the sausage which I added some minced, saut√©ed onion. Then the cheese and poured the egg mixture over all. I covered it with foil and let it sit overnight . I let it sit out for a bit before baking because I used stoneware. It was puffy and just so delicious.
Made the recipe as is, with exception of using tater tots instead of bread crumbs. Definitely a hit every Christmas morning and easy to make.

Crowd pleaser! In my family I have a mix of vegetarian and meat eaters. I replaced the sausage with veggie crumbles (could find veggie sausage crumbles) My family loved it, everyone, served it with salsa. Will make again
I added half bag of frozen hash browns with peppers and onions!

I made paleo waffles instead of bread and folio cheeses cut up. 
Yummy

I used an old hard stale baguette that I had to break up with a kitchen mallet, and I used sage sausage. It was super easy and so delicious! The servings are generous, so you could probably get 12 moderate-sized servings if you also serve a side of fruit with it.
I made this for Xmas morning and I made it again for my teenagers today! FOR VEGITARIANS! I just subbed soy crumble! Easiest and fastest recipe ever.
My family really liked it. I had to alter the recipe because I have two vegetarians in the family, so I used a plant-based sausage. The other family members didn‚Äôt seem to notice and gobbled it up.

This is my go-to recipe for any overnight company. 

This recipe is great as it is. Although i recommend not toasting the bread. If you don't toast the bread, it soaks up the cheese and sausage flavor better, and you get a fluffier casserole. 

And for a little extra flavor......

I partially render the sausage, covered, and then add onions, cook covered until mostly rendered. Then uncover and finish cooking until sausage is browned. 

Unless it's a REALLY greasy sausage, I don't drain the grease. (not the healthy choice, but, hey, it's Christmas) The grease soaks through the bread and eggs in the overnight soak and adds significantly to flavor. Add a tsp of herb infused olive oil and it's magnifique :)
We have this every year on Christmas morning and love it!
This was super good. I made it as written except I used maple sausage and laid down fresh pieces of sourdough instead of toasting/cubing. Sprinkle this with asiago!!! Sooooo good that way!
Added some Trader Joe's croutons (about half a bag) and used 6 eggs, used maple sausage. It was perfect.

I could not wrap my mind around putting bread in it and since I was making this for co-workers, I played it safe. I added 1 more egg and 3 1/2 cups of hash browns. I will try it with bread/toast next time and will adjust the stars if need be.

Soooo yummy!! I read the reviews and made a lot of the changes that were recommended. I used 8 eggs, used Jimmy Dean maple sausage, and I used cheese/garlic croutons. It was so good!! We will be making this again soon!
